title: Do product reviewers, unboxers, etc. like bloggers or YouTubers write off the products they purchase? If they sell those products, do they report them as revenue? - Quora

response.answer_text: Do product reviewers, unboxers, etc. like bloggers or YouTubers write off the products they purchase? If they sell those products, do they report them as revenue? These folks often receive goods for free in exchange for product endorsement, or are contractually bound to brands such as women’s makeup. It’s rare that products are purchased, and those who do buy out-of-pocket are reviewing low cost items or goods primarily purchased for personal use. I doubt many engage in product-taxation related issues unless they’re generating substantial revenue from their activities, and those who do would be in the small minority.
